iiv.data

Class AffineDataSlicer

  • java.lang.Object
    • iiv.data.AffineDataSlicer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CNUDataSlicer

    public class AffineDataSlicer
extends Object
implements CNUDataSlicer
    Class to convert data array into slices.
    Since:
    iiV1.1.8
    See Also:
    CNUDimensions

      static CNUDimensions calcMinBoundingDimensions(CNUDimensions inDims, AffineMatrix affineMatrix, XYZDouble rtn_min_origin)
      Determines a minimum dimension (x, y or z) to cover the whole area from a given input dimension transformed by an affine matrix.

      Calculates the transformed output resolutions given input resolutions and an the transform's affine matrix.

      Returns the affine matrix used by this data slicer.

      Gets the indices corresponding to the original data based on a point relative to this slice.

      Gets an equivalent data slicer that will work with a new set of dimensions.

      Returns a copy of the input data dimensions the data slicer uses.

      Returns number of slices supported by the data and slice view.

      Returns the dimension of slices this data slicer creates.

      Creates a script that may be used to recreate this data slicer.

                        double[][] inMatrix,
                        int sliceViewMode,
                        int outType)
        Constructs a new instance of PrimaryOrthoDataSlicer.
        Parameters:
        inDataDims - dimensions of data this data slicer will handle
        inMatrix - matrix representing the affine transform
        sliceViewMode - orientations of slices to create
        output - data type.

      • AffineDataSlicer

                        int outType)
        Constructs a new instance of PrimaryOrthoDataSlicer.
        Parameters:
        inDataDims - dimensions of data this data slicer will handle
        affineMatrix - affine matrix that defines the reslicing
        sliceViewMode - orientations of slices to create
        output - data type.

        public int[] getDataIndicesFromSlicePoint(Point pt,
                                          int slice)
        Gets the indices corresponding to the original data based on a point relative to this slice. Note - dims beyond the 3rd not handled by this.
        Specified by:
        getDataIndicesFromSlicePoint in interface CNUDataSlicer
        Parameters:
        pt - point to get indice for
        slice - slice the point is on
        Returns:
        the indices to the data

      • getSlicePointFromDataIndices

        public Point getSlicePointFromDataIndices(int[] indices)
        Gets the point relative to this slice given the indices corresponding to the original data.
        Specified by:
        getSlicePointFromDataIndices in interface CNUDataSlicer
        Parameters:
        indices - indices to original data which may have any number of dimensions
        Returns:
        location relative to slice (negative value for x or y indicates the indice does not map to that dimension)

      • mapIndices

        public int[] mapIndices(int[] indices)
        Maps indices relative to input data to output indices via the affine matrix.
        Parameters:
        origIndices - indices relative to underlying data
        Returns:
        indices relative to output slices. Output indices might not be on the current slice.

      • getSliceNumberFromDataIndices

        public int getSliceNumberFromDataIndices(int[] indices)
        Gets the slice number associated with a data indices location.
        Specified by:
        getSliceNumberFromDataIndices in interface CNUDataSlicer
        Parameters:
        indices - raw data location to determine slice number for
        Returns:
        slice number or -1 if not contained in data.

      • inSlice

        public boolean inSlice(int slice,
                       int[] indices)
        Determines if the given indices relative to the input data are located in the given slice.
        Specified by:
        inSlice in interface CNUDataSlicer
        Parameters:
        slice - slice to test for
        indices - indices to original raw data
        Returns:
        true if indices are located in the given slice.

      • grabSliceData

        public CNUData grabSliceData(CNUData inData,
                             int slice,
                             int iValue,
                             CNUData singlePlane,
                             CNUScale sc)
        Copies single slice into a 2-dimensional CNUData array.
        Specified by:
        grabSliceData in interface CNUDataSlicer
        Parameters:
        inData - data to copy from.
        slice - slice value relative to this resliced object to copy.
        iValue - i dimension relative to input data to copy slice from
        singlePlane - plane to copy data into. if null creates and copies into a new CNUData object.
        sc - scale object for converting input data type to output data type. May be null.
        Returns:
        CNUData object with scaled copy of slice data.

      • calcMinBoundingDimensions

        public static final CNUDimensions calcMinBoundingDimensions(CNUDimensions inDims,
                                                            AffineMatrix affineMatrix,
                                                            XYZDouble rtn_min_origin)
        Determines a minimum dimension (x, y or z) to cover the whole area from a given input dimension transformed by an affine matrix.
        Parameters:
        inDims - input dimensions that need to be covered
        affineMatrix - transform for converting input locations to output locations
        reslicedMinOrig - if not null used to return transformed minimum values associated with inDims
        Returns:
        dimensions required for output

      • calculateOutputResolutions

        public static final double[] calculateOutputResolutions(double[] inres,
                                                        AffineMatrix affineMatrix)
        Calculates the transformed output resolutions given input resolutions and an the transform's affine matrix.
        Parameters:
        inRes - input resolutions
        affineMatrix - transform as an affine matrix
        Returns:
        resolution as distances between integer values in transformed space
